title: 23-Year-Old Man left Permanently Blind from AstraZeneca COVID-19 Vaccine—Files Lawsuit in Manitoba, Canada

opengraph.description:
A new lawsuit in Canada charges that a COVID-19 vaccine injury left a 23-year-old young man legally blind.  As a consequence Jackson Troy Reimer and his parents from Manitoba have filed a lawsuit in the Court of King’s Bench in Steinbach, just southeast of Winnipeg.  After receiving the COVID-19 vaccine Jackson had a stroke which left him legally blind. Defendants in the case: AstraZeneca Canada, Verity Pharmaceuticals (manufacturers of COVIDSHIELD), Vail Resorts (his employer), the Vancouver Coastal Health Authority  (administered the vaccine) and the Attorney General of Canada. The plaintiff’s legal theory in this case: All of the defendants owed a duty of care to represent the actual risks associated with the COVID-19 vaccines. 
What vaccine and why?
